results.title: Horowitz in Moscow
results.creator_credit: Brian Large, Robert Dalrymple, Camivideo and Columbia Artists
results.brief_description: This video celebrates the return of Vladimir Horowitz to his home country, the Soviet Union, in 1986 to perform a musical recital at the Moscow Conservatory. It was to be the first important event in a series of cultural exchanges agreed to at the Geneva Summit in 1985. Horowitz calls himself an “ambassador of peace” as he talks to the media, his fans and his family. The biographical documentary captures the emotions of both Horowitz and his adoring fans as he performs some of his favourite compositions by such composers as Mozart, Chopin and Rachmaninov, among others. Interspersed throughout this demanding performance are images of Moscow, the people, streets and cityscape along with insightful interviews with Horowitz as he reminisces about his past. An absorbing and thoughtful documentary featuring some wonderful solo music played by one of the world’s best and highly regarded pianists.

results.title: American Ballet Theatre at the Met
results.creator_credit: Brian Large and National Video Corporation
results.brief_description: These three wonderful ballets plus a pas de deux were performed by the American Ballet Theater at the Metropolitan Opera House, New York, on 11 June 1984. Les Sylphides: Music by Frideric Chopin, choreography by Michel Fokine, conducted by Paul Connelly and featuring dancers Mikhail Baryshnikov, Cynthia Harvey, Marianna Tcherkassky, Cheryl Yeager. Sylvia: Music by Leo Delibes, choreography by George Balanchine, conducted by Alan Barker and featuring dancers Patrick Bissell, Martina Van Hamel. Triad: Music by Serge Prokofiev, choreography by Kenneth MacMillan, conducted by Alan Barker with violin solo by Dennis Cleveland and featuring dancers Robert La Fosse, Amanda McKerrow, Johan Renvall. Paquita: Music by Ludwig Minkus, choreography by Natalia Makarova, conducted by Paul Connelly and featuring dancers Fernando Bujones, Cynthia Gregory.

results.title: Rusalka
results.creator_credit: Derek Bailey, David Pountney, RM Arts and Landseer Film and Television Productions
results.brief_description: Lyrical fairytale in three acts of a water-nymph who falls in love with a human prince by Antonin Dvorak, libretto by Jaroslav Kvapil, produced by David Pountney and performed at the London Coliseum by the English National Opera Orchestra and Chorus conducted by Mark Elder. Features Eilene Hannan (Rusalka), John Treleaven (the Prince), Rodney Macann (the Water Spirit), Ann Howard (Jezibaba), Phyllis Cannan (the Foreign Princess), along with Cathryn Pope, Eileen Hulse, and Linda McLeod as the Wood-Nymphs. The simple but effective Victorian nursery setting with its fairytale atmosphere is designed by Stephanos Lazaridis.

results.title: Culture Club: a kiss across the ocean
results.creator_credit: Keef, Hugh Symonds, Keefco Productions and Virgin Vision
results.brief_description: Recorded live at Hammersmith Odeon, December 1983. The charismatic Boy George and his band Culture Club perform some of their most loved songs in this very enjoyable and entertaining concert. The band, made up of Boy George, Jon Moss, Roy Hay, and Mikey Craig are supported by the fabulous Helen Terry as back-up vocal.

results.title: The Decline of western civilization
results.brief_description: Documentary filmed December 1979 through May 1980 in Los Angeles, California on the hard-core punk rock culture movement that existed at the time. Features a cross-section of some of the prominent Los Angeles bands performing live on stage at The Arena, The Fleetwood, Club 88, Hong Kong Cafe and Cherrywood Studios, including Alice Bag Band, Black Flag, Catholic Discipline, Circle Jerks, Fear, Germs, and X. Also includes some insightful interviews with members of the bands, punk fans and music industry moguls as they discuss their lives, the punk phenomenon and their philosophy on life. WARNING: Contains strong use of language and some violent scenes.

results.title: Unfaithfully yours (1984)
results.creator_credit: Howard Zieff, Marvin Worth, Joe Wizan, Daniel Melnick and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This remake of the 1948 Preston Sturges classic stars Dudley Moore as the symphony conductor who imagines ways to get back at the wife he believes is unfaithful to him. As his jeaslousy escalates, the disastrous after-shocks provide an arrary of farcical situations as Claude lays traps, fantasizes about double murder and sets about stalking his prey. Also stars Armand Assante and Natassja Kinski.

results.title: The Rocky Horror picture show
results.creator_credit: Jim Sharman, Michael White and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The film begins with our innocent pair of lovers, Brad and Janet, stranded in a rain storm with the only available shelter being the weird Dr. Frank N. Furter mansion. Before the night is out Brad and Janet will lose their respective virginities to the Doctor, be introduced to his muscle-bound creation, Rocky, and battle the evil beings from the planet Transylvania. The plot is ridiculous, the music enjoyable and the whole thing is an outrageously good time. Possibly the most popular cult movie of all time and based on the original stage musical by Richard O’Brien. With Richard O’Brien, Susan Sarandon, Nell Campbell and Patricia Quinn all doing the “Time warp”. Tim Curry steals the show with an over-the-top performance as the sex mad Doctor.

results.title: Return to Oz
results.creator_credit: Walter Murch, Paul Maslansky and Oz Productions
results.brief_description: Based on L. Frank Baum’s two follow-up books to The Wizard of Oz, “Return to Oz” is not quite the frolicking musical fantasy of the original family film and it may prove a bit too scary for the younger viewer. Dorothy (Fairuza Balk), since returning home from the Land of Oz, cannot clear her head of the wonderful adventures and amazing characters she had come to know and love. Auntie Em, determined to rid Dorothy of all this Oz nonsense, sends her off for psychiatric treatment at a sanitarium. However, Dorothy is rescued by a mysterious girl and just as mysteriously ends up back in the Land of Oz where all is not as it was and the magical fantasy begins to turn into a nightmare adventure. Cast includes Nicol Williamson, Jean Marsh, Piper Laurie, Matt Clark. Parental guidance recommended.

results.title: Shanghai noon
results.creator_credit: Tom Dey, Jonathan Glickman, Roger Birnbaum, Gary Barber, Touchstone Pictures, Spyglass Entertainment and Jackie Chan Films
results.brief_description: A case of East meets West in this comic adventure Jackie Chan film set in 1850s American West. Chon Wang (Jackie Chan), an Imperial Guard, is sent across to America as part of a rescue team to find the Emperor’s kidnapped daughter, Princess Pei Pei (Lucy Liu). However it is not long before Chon Wang becomes separated from the search party and finds himself lost out in the vast open spaces of the West where he has a timely encounter with a bright but arrogant train robber by the name of Roy O’Bannon (Owen Wilson). The two become unlikely allies. Cast also includes Brandon Merrill, Roger Yuan.

results.title: Down and out in Beverly Hills
results.creator_credit: Paul Mazursky, Pato Guzman and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: A wealthy but bitterly unhappy married couple take in a tramp who attempts suicide in their pool. Becoming ensconced in their lives, the tramp (played by Nick Nolte) facilitates a re-evaluation of the family’s dubious moral codes. A remake of Jean Renoir’s 1932 film “Boudu saved from drowning” this hilarious comedy with Richard Dreyfuss and Bette Midler as the warring couple, garnered many accolades and was nominated for two Golden Globes.
